item.title: Lab 4
item.description: Objectives To observe wireless signal path loss in WiFi frequencies due to different types of obstacles Useful Lab Task: lab4-task.

item.title: Wifi 2
item.description: Highest data rate isn’t always the best.

item.title: Lab 3
item.description: Objectives To observe path loss phenomenon under LoS condition by analysing RSS at different distances To estimate path loss exponent for indoor and outdoor under LoS Measurements Measurements were taken over a 5 metre distance, with ten 0.

item.title: Lab 2
item.description: Objectives To learn WiFi tracing, filtering, and data export using Wireshark To observe some fundamental properties of wireless signal strength and noise through capturing and analysing real WiFi trace Useful Lab Task: lab2-task.

item.title: Week 1 Quiz
item.description: Frequency hopping requires less bandwidth because it never uses the same channel for too long.

item.title: Physical Layer Fundamentals
item.description: Frequency, Period, Phase Frequency - $ f $ Period - $ T = 1/f $ Phase - $ \phi $ Amplitude - $ A $ Wave - $ A \sin(2 \pi ft + \phi) $ I-Q Graph The I-Q graph is a 2D representation of the phase and amplitude.

item.title: Trends in Mobile Networks
item.description: 1946 - First PTT Mobile 1970 - First Cellular Phone Service 1971 - First Wireless Data Network 1990 - WLAN 1999 - WiFi WiFi is used worldwide 5 billion Bluetooth devices in 2020 Wireless speed growth follows Moore’s Law Growth doubles and cost halves every 2 years
